ðŸ“– Summary: Redka is a Redis reimplementation that uses SQL as its underlying data store, offering persistence and ACID transactions. It can be used as an embedded cache in Go applications or as a standalone server, supporting both SQLite and PostgreSQL backends. Redka aims to provide Redis-like data structures with the benefits of a relational database.
